title: Planning a Community Approach to Diabetes Care in Low- and Middle-Income Countries Using Optimization. (arXiv:2305.06426v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Diabetes is a global health priority, especially in low- and-middle-income countries, where over 50% of premature deaths are attributed to high blood glucose. Several studies have demonstrated the feasibility of using Community Health Worker (CHW) programs to provide affordable and culturally tailored solutions for early detection and management of diabetes. Yet, scalable models to design and implement CHW programs while accounting for screening, management, and patient enrollment decisions have not been proposed. We introduce an optimization framework to determine personalized CHW visits that maximize glycemic control at a community-level. Our framework explicitly models the trade-off between screening new patients and providing management visits to individuals who are already enrolled in treatment. translated_title: 在低收入和中等收入国家中利用优化规划社区糖尿病护理计划
translated_abstract: 糖尿病是全球健康优先事项，尤其是在低收入和中等收入国家，超过50%的早逝归因于高血糖。多项研究已经证明使用社区卫生工作者（CHW）计划提供早期发现和管理糖尿病的可承受和文化定制解决方案的可行性。然而，还没有提出可扩展的模型来设计和实施CHW计划，同时考虑筛查、管理和患者招募决策。我们引入了一个优化框架来确定个性化的CHW访问，以在社区水平上最大化血糖控制。我们的框架明确建模了筛查新患者和为已经入治疗的个体提供管理访问之间的权衡。我们考虑患者的动机状态，这影响他们决定入治疗或退出的决定，因此影响干预的有效性。我们结合这些因素来实现智能个性化的CHW访问计划。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种优化框架来设计可扩展的社区卫生工作者计划，以在社区水平上最大化血糖控制，考虑筛查、管理和患者招募决策，以及患者的动机状态和干预的有效性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes an optimization framework for designing scalable Community Health Worker (CHW) programs that maximize glycemic control at a community-level, taking into account screening, management, and patient enrollment decisions, as well as patients' motivational states and the effectiveness of the intervention.
